channel.title: Hello Boys!
channel.description:
[center]Hey forum users. I'll be going by the name EasyWan Capi through and across this board and a couple others.
I've recently been blessed with a baby boy & double blessed by Jamflex banning my OS account! :smileyface: I finally have the release and freedom I've been needing to focus on my own self/career.
My Goal at this time is learning to code my own source and client!(It'll take some time. Yes I'm aware.)
I've been toying with the idea of building my own RSPS also leading to me perusing knowledge in ACTUAL java coding. Before this moment I spent the last summer learning "RSPS java." Unfortunately during the summer I was stuck with a data plan, no longer am I.
Anyway, I have basic java down which has made things x100 easier to understand.
SO! Thank you all for reading this little introduction. Plan on seeing EasyWan Capi around :smileyface:[/center]

item.title: Hello Boys!
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[center]Hello
May I recommend using Mod Taharoks Compiler
If you have any questions contact Tom, he will help you[/center]

Read full topic

item.title: Hello Boys!
item.dc:creator: @EasyWan_Capi EasyWan Capi
item.description:
@EasyWan_Capi wrote:

Soulcist:

Hi, welcome to MoparScape. And just so you know, as you’re probably going to be told again… don’t use RSPS to learn Java. I personally have never built upon the idea of learning Java VIA RSPS because I went to web development and such a few years back but from my understanding, it’s like the worst thing to do - ever (or at least as people make it out to seem).

I am very aware of this my dear and it is why I’m taking the time to learn learn real java.

Read full topic
